abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Technical
            Assistance Project for Public and Private Provision of
            Infrastructure are to initiate immediate actions to:  (a)
            assess priorities in current infrastructure plans; and (b)
            augment and enhance program evaluation capability.  The loan
            will provide funds to finance:  (i) expert review panels
            (ERPs) to review and evaluate the findings and
            recommendations of recent and ongoing policy, strategy and
            major project preparation studies; (ii) in-house advisory
            services to strengthen procedures and methodologies for the
            evaluation of investment proposals; (iii) study teams for
            specific tasks; (iv) project preparation and engineering
            design services; (v) conduct of new prefeasibility and
            feasibility studies for urgently needed investments; (vi)
            equipment and training; and (vii) establishment of a system
            for project monitoring and documentation.  Studies will
            include investments, for example, in high-capacity road
            links, power generation and telecommunications services, in
            which private sector participation could be sought in a
            manner which supports the policy interests of the government
            and, at the same time, minimizes the impact on the
            government budget.
